metadata.title: CVE-2017-7558 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A kernel data leak due to an out-of-bound read was found in the Linuxkernel in inet_diag_msg_sctp{,l}addr_fill() and sctp_get_sctp_info()functions present since version 4.7-rc1 through version 4.13. A data leakhappens when these functions fill in sockaddr data structures used toexport socket's diagnostic information. As a result, up to 100 bytes of theslab data could be leaked to a userspace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required
